I'll keep this review short:


8.5.


Pros: Fantastically creepy atmosphere (let's be honest, the most important thing in this type of game), great graphics, brilliant music and sound effects, very interesting story (dat cliffhanger ending tho) and more jumpscares than Amnesia and Slender combined.


Cons: Repetitive gameplay (turn on a valve, hide, run to the next one, turn it on, hide). That's really the only con.


I highly recommend it. If you've not yet bought it, do it!

I've had this in my collection for a little while, and finally had the time to play it this evening. I thoroughly enjoyed it. I love a good story, especially one that reveals itself bit by bit over time. I felt that rummaging through their personal possessions made me understand the dynamics of this family. For me, the story is thought provoking, the attention to detail impeccable, and the ambience just really draws me in. At first, I thought the game would take a horror bend, but it didn't, and for that I'm thankful. In the end, it's a simple, heartfelt story. I completely agree with your rating.

Solid fun game. Its a basic plat former but theres actually a lot of different items that change the mechanics of the game.
There's ice pads that make you slip , float. Gravity pads, flip you upside down, pogo sticks ( just as it sounds ) and more. So theres a little versatility into the game.
I'm not quite sure how long the campaign is, or if the campaign is randomly generated like the other modes, but im closing in level 120 and it's a blast.
If you need a plat former fix, THIS is the one to buy.

This game goes from fun Castlevania-esque roguelite to irritating Ikaruga bull donks in under 30 minutes. Literally. That's how long I had been playing before the game saw fit to drop 5 eyeballs, 4 fire mages, 4 ice wizards, floor spikes, 2 turrets, and a handful of those annoying painting monsters in the FIRST room I entered. There was maybe one square inch on my screen that was safe at best, and that's being generous. I'm all for a good bit of challenge, but 37 projectiles firing at your face before the screen even fully loads is nonsense. I may not even mind that at one of the later stages in the castle, but that was seriously the first enemy room I came across. I want to enjoy this game, I really do, but it's mostly just irritating.

If you're a die hard fan of Ikaruga-esque dodge-em-ups, Rogue Legacy is for you. If you're looking for a fun Castlevania style dungeon crawler you're better off spending your money on an old, beat up PS/Saturn and digging SotN out of your closet.

Limited challenge? This makes no sense. The game is what it is, and is not so easy, it's an exploration game with puzzles and good challenge.

It's one of the most creative games I ever played in recent years (thank god I have not played Pikmin 1 and 2, because this is making the experience with pikmin 3 even better).
The story is simple like other nintendo games, but the gameplay is so good, and using the wii remote or the gamepad are equally great. It's probably a game of a single play, but it's not small, the story maybe, but like Mario games, you can finish the game and it's just half of the things you can do, you have a lot of hidden things to collect that are fun to collect, cause the challenge is in these things.
The only problem of the game are the boring presentation and the need for going back to the ship after every end of day, that at some point becomes a boring thing. But never ruins the gameplay. 9/10.

On top of that it has the fast moving/seizure inducing jump shake that the amiga generation of platformers were notorious for especially (games like jazz the jackrabbit & Zool comes to mind). And what is wit hthis games unfair dissapearing/reappearing platforms, its beyond stupid that they move between these states in a nano second leading to a bunch of tedium deaths and tolerance testing amount of time to pass em. I have rarely played such a poor platformer as this. Just glad i got it from a humble bundle thing after hearing so much good about it for the 3ds i guess the reason for that must be the amount of lack of retro games or better games on that system.

Ugh, so far it's a tiring and unfair experience. Bad enemy placement galore. That's the main issue with the game. Without that, it would be perfectly fine, but the enemy placement is so stupid, so brainlessly executed, it's insane. The enemies are placed in ways that make it practically impossible to avoid them. The game is frustrating because of this, and it's a blessing that it gives you unlimited continues, because otherwise I would have deleted it immediately. It's strangely addicting, but it's heavily flawed.

TRUE FACT:This amazing video game was inpsired by The ship of Theseus, also known as Theseus' paradox, is a thought experiment that raises the question of whether an object that has had all of its components replaced remains fundamentally the same object. The paradox is most notably recorded by Plutarch in Life of Theseus from the late first century. Plutarch asked whether a ship that had been restored by replacing every single wooden part remained the same ship.

Never have I been so let down by the people saying,"this game is so amazing, get it!" This game doesn't feel all that amazing, it just feels mediocre and hollow. The only thing it really has going for it are boss battles and crafting, there's no story, no interesting characters, no big interesting world to explore for any reason other than collecting. There is grinding and collecting, that's pretty much it. The only reason you get so many hours out of this game is because you'll constantly need to kill the same bosses over and over to make weapons and armor, which can take up to an hour each time you fight. There is also a time limit which is stupid.
I also hear everyone talking about how amazing the gameplay is, which still seems mediocre. I wouldn't say this if basic animations weren't slow as hell or if weapons were more interesting to use, which half of them are also slow as hell. Yeah, handicapping the player with slow, stupid animations and other stupid gameplay elements makes for some pretty amazing gameplay. The game feels and looks like something from nearly a decade ago, with the exception of the great monster designs. Underwater combat is also downright terrible. The game can be fun sometimes, mostly when playing with other people but all it's faults don't just go out the window just because you're playing with friends.

It's not about the story. Monster Hunter is all gameplay, all day. If you've never played it before, yeah, it's got a learning curve. It's not really a simple game. It's got a lot of nuance. I just feel sorry for you, because from your statement you seem to be a very impatient person. Monster Hunter is an extremely rewarding experience in all its renditions, and it definitely takes a good deal of patience. Obviously not every game is meant for every player, and that's okay.
What's NOT okay is you calling aspects of this game objectively "terrible," referring to the game itself as a "p.o.s." when quite clearly, it's not. It's very well-made, it's very deep, very complex, very good. You can not like it all you want, that doesn't make it bad, though. It's just different, and it's not for you. But don't go tearing it down so much just because you were bit in the butt by your expectations.

Let me tell you (anyone skeptical about how grind-like the game looks, if it does appear that way) that this game may be a grind, but it is the most fun grind you will ever experience. Every fight, even if it's with the same monster, can go a different direction, monsters do new things you may have not seen, and you have fun because you learn the nuances of each monster, and how each one moves. You slowly master the combat of each monster, and then finally, you'll be satisfied. Make the armor, then you'll go on to the new one, to do it again, learn new things, make new stuff. This game is worth playing multiple characters just so you can focus on different weapon types, they are that diverse. Get this game. Do it.
exactly, if a grind that doesn't bore you or doesn't seem like a grind, is a grind well done.

I know how old this comment is, but if you have yet to get it... short answer is YES! It's so worth it! Monster Hunter is no less rewarding on your own! And you can still go to Port Tanzia on your own and do those quests by yourself, though you might have a bit of a rough time doing so, as they weren't really designed for single player... But if you have a Wii U, don't worry about it, because there's online play! Even if you have the 3DS version, and you still have a Wii U, you can play the 3DS version online by using your Wii U as a sort of gateway using a free tool on the Wii U's eShop. MH3U is seriously so worth it, and I'd say go ahead and get it, and then bring all your stupid friends over to your house and make them jealous with how awesome Monster Hunter is, and then they'll want to get a 3DS or Wii U and play it with you anyway :P

Has anyone tried this with a Wii mote gun controller yet, like the Wii-zapper? It's very awkward accessing all buttons (although the 3rd party zapper I have makes it slightly easier due to the trigger handle being removable so you hold it more like a shotgun) but despite the awkwardness, and with a bit of tweaking the controls for personal preference (thumbs up to treyarch for just how customisable the controls are) this feels like a fully new experience. I've not even tried the gamepad yet because I just can't get over how accurate and stable the pointer aiming is, or how good it really feels to play it this way! Probably got to admit its a little to hard to do zombies this way, when every second counts but in comparison to MW3 which I played on Xbox with a normal pad, the campaign feels like a true next gen experience! I'm surprised the reviewer only touched on Wii-mote controls and didn't mention this Wii zapper way to play. Definitely a bit harder, definitely takes some getting used to but I can't get over how good it feels. Wish someone would make a similar gun which somehow lets you access all the Wii-more buttons whilst still keeping this feel. Without accurate next gen expensive motion capture tech an oculus rift headset, I think this is the closest I'm getting to VR in my own home! Try it, and long enough to get used to it!

Just got this game free on PS4. I thought it would be pure crap, but it's not just good, it's really good! A breath of fresh air for the horror/zombie genre. My man & I got a second hand Wii U as an experiment - being 'of a certain age' (60) we missed the gaming thing growing up and we (he) wanted to have a go. We got a few games to go with it, most of which I have found a real disappointment. However....Zombiu...OMG!! It has taken over my life for a couple of months, entertained me endlessly and scared the crap out of me over..and over...and over...again. It is SO much fun. This review is seriously flawed (did this Greg person actually play this game??) - there *is* a lot of 'cut & pasted' scenery in the stairwells & short cuts, it takes ages to load sometimes (often, as you get further in) and there are other problems, sure. But generally it is seriously atmospheric and creepy, the Prepper is an engaging character, and it totally does what you would expect for a survival horror game. There are loads of extra weapons to be had as you go along, there's plenty of strategising, oh and the dying....don't forget the dying, there's a lot of that! This game has set a high bar for us, and now we're exchanging the WiiU for a Ps4 I really hope we can find other stuff that will provide as much entertainment for money as this has. Shame on you, IGN, for talking such rubbish.

"Still life in 2D". For the fourth time in it's own series. Or more, if you think what came out before it that was clearly influenced by the original and Wii. Mega Man 9 & 10. Sonic The Hedgehog 4 Episode I & II. Kirby's Return To Dream Land. Rayman Origins. Rocket Knight. Donkey Kong Country Returns. And a couple after, with The Legend Of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds, Yoshi's New Island, and sequels to aforementioned games, like Kirby: Triple Deluxe, Rayman Legends, and Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze. If anything, I want the power of 3D to come back to half these franchises now.

Im not a big fan of this entry. It feels like a task to play through. (Although it can be fun in co op). NSMBU is by no means a terrible game, but I definitely would not consider it a 9.1. Its decent, more like a 7.5 in my book. I think you will find that the game averaged out around there. Im surprised Mr. George rated it so highly. I grew up on all the original Mario titles. This is my first shot at the "new" series. If youre looking for platformers check out Super Mario 3D World, Donkey Kong:Tropical Freeze, Rayman Legends and Shovel Knight.

I just don't get it. With nsmbw, IGN freaked about about how the multiplayer mode was so amazingly fun. They practically told us the game was 60% better if you had buddies with wiimotes! Now they're telling us it's so horrible that you'll only like the game if you play it in single player (and that multiplayer mode is clumsy and chaotic) when nothing changed in the multiplayer modes between nsmbw and nsmbu except for the fact that you now optionally can add a 5th player who assists you by placing platforms with the wii u gamepad. It's not required at all. It's just an option. I mean, I'd understand it if they said that this game is better in single player because, idk, the level design is meant for one player unlike nsmbw's, or whatever. But they gave no reason. They just downright proclaimed the multiplayer mode in this game as awful when nintendo didn't change it from the previously called "brilliant" multiplayer in nsmbw.
Does this reviewer just have some really annoying friends? Or what?

Yeah I was actually thinking the same thing. I have this problem with a lot of movies and games; they get decent reviews and then later people refer to them as if they were crap. I remember specifically IGN saying how great and fun the multi-player on NSMB was.

My husband and I got this for free with Mario Kart 8, and we are enjoying playing the game together. Sure, it makes it chaotic sometimes…but it is also hilarious. We used to do 3 player coop and sometimes even 4 player coop with friends on the Wii and we were laughing the entire time.

People complain so much about PS Plus offerings but if it wasn't for this being one of the games of the month for August I would have never given this gem a look. One of the most fun, simplistic, and relaxing games I have played in a while. This is one of those games that just makes you happy to be alive. I love the fact that you can create levels as well and put up for people to download. Glad this got the score it deserved back in 2012. Please download for "free" if you haven't gotten the chance yet.
